text:
The background thread that recycles sessions based on timeouts uses 
Session.getLastAccessedTime().
The session object itself has two variables
lastAccessedTime and thisAccessedTime.
-----------------------------------------
    public long getLastAccessedTime() 
    {
	return (this.lastAccessedTime);
    }
--------------------------------------------
lastAccessedTime is the time a request is made BEFORE the present request.
So, getLastAccessedTime is the time of the (last-1)request 
and not the last request.

Shouldnt getLastAccessedTime return thisAccesstime?
creator: murthy@teamon.com

text:
Servlet specv2.3 clarifies this and mentions that getLastAccessedTime should 
return the time of the request prior to the current one.

BUT then, Session-expiry background thread (thread that checks if the sessions
have expired) should NOT look at this time.. it should be looking at the time 
of the client's last request and so should not use getLastAccessedTime().
I'll modify the summary of the bug accordingly.
creator: murthy@teamon.com
